programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Haute Tarentaise, land of extremes We set off to explore the Haute Tarentaise, a high alpine valley in the far reaches of the Savoie. This impressive setting, surrounded by glaciers, towering peaks and mountain passes rendered impassable in winter, is home to a wide range of extreme sports. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Spicing up the festive season!
Cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and ginger add a characteristic touch to certain festive recipes. Discover the history of these exotic spices... Also on the programme: a buying guide for wine glasses; all about fonio, a new grain from Africa; and a compilation of twenty years of Christmas programmes from the archives!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Oise, from Chantilly to the Compiègne Forest On the very edge of Paris, the department of the Oise is home to some architectural gems. We visit the sumptuous Domaine de Chantilly, completely rebuilt by the Duke of Aumale in the 19th century, and the majestic Beauvais Cathedral, proud of having wanted to be the tallest in Europe. Directed by: Anne-Sophie Margerel (season 6, France, 2019)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc:
Limoges, surprising museum
It's here in Limoges, town of art and history, that you are invited to discover the incredible collections housed in the city's Museum of Fine Arts and the Adrien Dubouché Museum. A totally immersive visit.
Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Pic du Midi de Bigorre - Encounter with the globetrotting artist Nicolas Lefebvre - Paris, real or illusion? - Focus on the designer Laura Cambon and her creative glasswork Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.sub-title: École de village restaurée près de Houffalize
programme.desc: Renovated village school near Houffalize A remarkable result for the renovation of this village school dating from 1870. Jeanne and Amaury used the most environmentally-friendly materials possible. Weekend in Brussels: the Jam Hotel offers a contemplative immersion "made in Japan". Legal affairs with a look at Izimi, the virtual safe. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays de Fayence
In the Var, Hugo and Anne-Noëlle open the doors to a farm where they also cultivate well-being. At the Claux Farm, Daniel and Laure offer an open invitation to sample their dairy produce. All about mimosas in Tanneron and the hilltop villages of the Pays de Fayence.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Exploring Jura's regional identity Champagnole is the perfect starting point to visit one of France's best fir plantations: Joux Forest. Guillaume discovers this mysterious would, to learn more about the Jura's regional identity! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Treats for dogs
The pandemic saw a rise in the number of pets being adopted. Result: the range of products on offer also increased! But how to make the right choice? Also on the programme: different types of Asian sauces, a focus on Indian bread and the range of crèmes caramel now available.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Puy-de-Dôme, land of volcanoes Emblem of the Chaîne des Puys, a chain of volcanoes that have remained dormant for over 11,000 years, the Puy de Dôme is a favourite destination for paragliding enthusiasts and renowned for its Gallo-Roman ruins. An electric train takes tourists to discover its breathtaking panorama and atmospheric observatory. Directed by: Katia Chapoutier (season 6, France, 2019)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc:
Limoges, surprising museum
It's here in Limoges, town of art and history, that you are invited to discover the incredible collections housed in the city's Museum of Fine Arts and the Adrien Dubouché Museum. A totally immersive visit.
Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 1:

An in-depth look at the secrets of the French luxury industry, and earrings for men. The Marseilles collective Laissez Passer recycles below-standard and abandoned harbour materials. How to wear satin, whatever the occasion. The association Fleurs d'Halage offers a second life to polluted areas of Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Flora Mikula
One of the few women to have forged a career in a male-dominated world, the chef Flora Mikula settled in the Camargue. She guides us from Nîmes to the boundaries of the Rhône delta, on foot, on horseback, by car... for wonderful food, cheery banter and general love of life.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in harmony with nature Carole-Lyne Robin has transformed her life by building an off-grid tiny house. Between working as a volunteer with the reindeer and her job as a wildlife ranger, Carole-Lyne lives in harmony with her environment. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Bundt cake and madeleines
Using the same vanilla-flavoured cake mixture, Ricardo prepares two different desserts: a marbled mocha Bundt cake and green tea and frosted lemon madeleines.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Cordouan, the last inhabited lighthouse
Recently added to the Unesco world heritage list, the Cordouan lighthouse welcomes thousands of visitors each year. For several centuries, it has been an invaluable aid for the complex navigation required to enter the Gironde estuary. A truly exceptional building and an important witness of the history of France. Report by: Olivier Chasle.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Savoie, from Aix-les-Bains to the Haute-Maurienne A region of mountain-lovers and home to some veritable treasures: from the enchanting Le Bourget Lake to the delightful Belle Époque charm of Aix-les-Bains, renowned spa resort since the Gallo-Roman era. In the Doron Valley, the scenery of the Beaufortain has been dramatically re-designed by its hydroelectric dams. Directed by: Charles Bourla (season 6, France, 2019)

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread Chuck Hughes teaches us how to cook lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Stéphano, Frelishburg Amélie and Stéphano were born and bred in Montreal. But despite being very attached to the city, they dreamed of a better life without neighbours. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the Garde Républicaine. Shells of every description enjoy a new lease of life thanks to the expert fingers of Thomas Boog, interior designer and creator of decorative objects. Three essential addresses for sculpture-lovers. In the Pyrenees, the VillaCampa workshop manufactures exceptional skis made in wood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
